page.title: 18RELIGION
page.content: ANGLICAN The Anglican church is dedicated to St. John the Evangelist and is in Lund-in- Salwick, ref 46 31. It is built of stone in three stages. The nave was built in 1824, the chancel added in 1852 and the tower in 1873. There was a private chapel here since 1329 which belonged to the Roman Catholic Clifton family, but it was pulled down in 1824. The most important service is the 10.30am Family Communion. ROMAN CATHOLIC The R.C. church in the area is at Lea Town, 44 31, and is dedicated to St. Mary the Virgin. It is a small church, about 130 years old and is built of brick. NON-CONFORMIST There is no Non-conformist church in our block OTHERS. This constitutes about 1%.
